Summary:- Female, 22 years old, BMI 40, heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pain- Two prior pregnancies with cesarean sections- History of PCOS, appendectomy

Assessment and Advice:The patient, a 22-year-old female with a BMI of 40, presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and pelvic pain. Examination reveals an enlarged uterus, suggestive of fibroids. Further evaluation with ultrasound is recommended to confirm the diagnosis. Treatment options include medication for bleeding control or surgical intervention like myomectomy. Addressing PCOS is crucial for menstrual cycle regulation. Referral to a gynecologist for comprehensive management is advised.
